DOC.brief_title: Effects Teaching Intervention With Advanced Practice Nurse Quality Life Psychosocial Symptom Distress Patients With Ovarian Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To compare effect standardized nursing intervention protocol ( SNIP ) model advanced practice nurse v usual care overall quality life psychological distress initial treatment 6 month diagnosis patient ovarian cancer . - To compare symptom control patient . - To compare geriatric assessment outcome patient . - To compare effect SNIP intervention v usual care resource use patient . - To test effect SNIP patient ' clinician ' satisfaction care . - To describe effect SNIP management transition one phase chronic illness another . - To identify subgroups patient ovarian cancer benefit SNIP relation sociodemographic characteristic , disease/treatment factor , geriatric assessment predictor . - To obtain feedback clinician regard interpretation finding application routine care ovarian cancer patient . OUTLINE : Patients stratify accord age ( 18 60 year vs 61 year ) . Patients sequentially enrol 1 2 group . Patients initially enrol group I . Once enrollment group I complete , additional patient enrol group II . - Group I ( usual care ) : Patients complete questionnaire , include FACT-Ovarian , Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale , Psychological Distress Thermometer , Comprehensive Geriatric Assessment , baseline 3 6 month . Clinicians also complete questionnaire , include Clinician Satisfaction Intervention Questionnaire . Patients ' medical chart review collect information treatment , episodes care , readmission . - Group II ( advanced practice nurse [ APN ] intervention ) : Patients undergo face-to-face individualized teaching session APN twice month 2 month . The session focus patient 's physical , psychological , social , spiritual well-being content tailor patient 's preference need . Patients contact APN via telephone month 4 month clarify question content teach session , review patient concern , include concern associate transition , coordinate interdisciplinary resource , include community resource , need . Patients clinicians complete questionnaire group I . Patients ' medical chart also review .
